website_summaries.verdict: One of the more popular running undergarments available for online purchase, this comfortable product is sure to impress.
pros: Made of nylon and spandex for supreme comfort
Customers rave over their remarkable comfort
cons: Tend to sit low on the waist, causing them to ride down for some

customer_reviews.title: Beware design change
customer_reviews.text: I started wearing these four years ago and loved them. A 5-star product -- well-made, durable, comfortable, washes out quickly. Then I recently bought two more, just to have in reserve. There has been a design change: the panel is still two thicknesses of material, BUT they are NOT sewn together at the front. I suppose it saves money in manufacturing. It could be intended to make the layer next to the body more flexible. But it's a poor design for anyone that uses a pantyliner or similar item, because the pantyliner doesn't stay in place. I returned both pairs and will not buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Avian OH

customer_reviews.title: Have a great workout with these breathable undies that don't ride up
customer_reviews.text: I have trouble finding undies and spandex shorts that don't ride up when I work out. I'm 5'5", a bottom-heavy 130 (muscular legs/hips), waist about 27" and hips about 38-39" and size medium fits snugly without pinching. Perfect for wearing under basketball shorts! They're also great for hot weather; they breathe well and seem to wick sweat effectively.
customer_reviews.author: kb_foo

customer_reviews.title: Best athletic panty I've tried so far.
customer_reviews.text: This is really the only "high-tech" athletic panty I've found that won't ride up immediately upon any type of movement so I have to give big props for that. Fabric is light and comfy. They will give you a visible panty line but the way they are cut makes it a little less noticeable (leg holes sort of follow the natural crease under your butt, granny panty style). They are pretty pricey but if you need an athletic panty I recommend these for comfort and no wedgies.
customer_reviews.author: AppleSnap

customer_reviews.title: Good panty
customer_reviews.text: This is a good panty but I think in general I prefer normal style undies. Hipkinis are not my fave. This one is light and airy though. Only complaint is when pulling them up the waist band part feels a little too tight (like not quite enough stretch) and this is my normal size. But once they are pulled up they feel fine and do not constrict me. Not sure I will buy this style again but I do love this brand!
customer_reviews.author: Luv2shopns

customer_reviews.title: She loves them
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my GF before a backpacking trip because she complained about her other brand underwear was always riding up while backpacking. I use and love the mens boxers from ExOfficio and thought she'd like these. Well, she bought a 2nd pair since she liked these so well!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for Travel
customer_reviews.text: The underwear is lightweight and dries quickly. For me personally, the underwear rides up more than I like but I'm keeping them because I travel a lot and need underwear that I can wash in the sink and dry quickly. The color is as described and the fabric and stitching is good quality so it doesn't unravel after repeated washings.
customer_reviews.author: BornToTravel

customer_reviews.title: Best boyshorts!
customer_reviews.text: Found size chart to be accurate. Best boyshorts money can buy. They don't ride up or stretch out, they are lightweight and they don't show a line through pants. Bought a pair for every day off the week!
customer_reviews.author: running girl

customer_reviews.title: Certainly not cute, but...
customer_reviews.text: Finally, a product description you can believe. The dreaded “ride up” has been defeated! But, this means a lot more material than the average panty. Worth the price for peace of mind!
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable for long hikes
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable for long hikes. Doesn’t ride up. I do feel like this style runs bigger than the regular undies. I usually wear a medium in this brand (size 6/8) but these are a tad big.
customer_reviews.author: TrailRunner

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable but expensive
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and good fit. Only downside is price. Can get equivalent for less money.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia N. Liu

customer_reviews.title: Pretty comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Great comfort but they do get a little twisted up when you put shorts on overtop. Once they are straightened out though they don’t ride up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ride up a bit
customer_reviews.text: The first wear was really nice and they do dry very quickly but I find that they ride up a bit. Still comfortable enough but not my favorite pair of underwear.
customer_reviews.author: A. Strohm

customer_reviews.title: Noticeable Panty lines- no thanks
customer_reviews.text: For ladies with hips or thicker legs, these make terrible panty lines. I returned them because of that.
customer_reviews.author: KH17

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Favorite underwear I've ever open. Helps prevent leaks, breathable, comfortable. Great for travel, easy to wash, quick to dry.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Hartley

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love these undies! The Hipkini is super flattering and doesn't show lines in my summer work pants.
customer_reviews.author: Northside 415

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: Love these undies!! So comfy, they don’t ride up! Super breathable and you hardly notice you are wearing underwear at all.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Eichhorn

customer_reviews.title: I never want to wear anything else
customer_reviews.text: Seriously the most comfortable pair of underwear I've owned. Dried within hours, in a hot climate. Dried overnight in a damp one.
customer_reviews.author: santas helper

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable. Shapes to my body contour. Wicks away moisture during workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Travel light!
customer_reviews.text: 3 weeks in Europe +3 pairs of ExOfficio undies = light and care free travel. Loved them!!! They dry quickly, I felt great all day, I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Pena-Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Finally the right undies!
customer_reviews.text: Game changers. Super comfy and durable- great for long distance running!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for use during physical training
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to take to OCS and during Phase 1 there is little time for sleep, hygiene, and we are constantly soaking wet from all of the "corrective training" and PT in the heat of Alabama. These dried pretty quickly and never smelled like the day I had. They are pretty durable for washing them with ACUs/OCPs. They were great.
customer_reviews.author: Flgirl

customer_reviews.title: The tags are crazy
customer_reviews.text: My husband got these for me since he has the male counterpart and loves them. I will first say I do love the fit of them. But... if I am paying $15 for one pair of undies I would expect them to be tag free. These don’t have a little tag in fact they have 3 and 2 are super long. It’s super annoying. I haven’t decided if I should seam rip them out and chance a hole or cut and chance the infinite scratching. It brings the product down for sure
customer_reviews.author: Heather D

customer_reviews.title: Material Stretched Out On First Wear
customer_reviews.text: Material stretched out on the first wear, one leg hole was larger than the other. I emailed Exofficio twice and never heard back.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for long distance hiking
customer_reviews.text: I recently wore these on my thru hike of the Appalachian Trail. They lasted 5 months and were still in great condition. They dry very quickly, fit perfectly, and are basically the perfect underwear.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Weeks

product_meta.title: ExOfficio Women's Give-N-Go Sport Mesh Hipkini
product_meta.description: When your itinerary calls for hikes, treks, and days of active exploring, you'll want a pair (or two) of ExOfficio Women's Give-N-Go Sport Mesh Hipkinis in your bag. This underwear features an active fit and low rise so you'll be comfortable from the tarmac to the trail. Odor-resistant technology and breathable mesh will leave you feeling fresh. When it's time to head to your next destination, just toss this underwear in the laundry or wash it in the sink—it will be dry and ready to wear within hours.
feature_bullets: These women's mesh hipkini underwear are great to take in your pack or carry-on for long hikes, multi-day trips, and anywhere performance, comfort, and freshness are your top concerns
Odor-reducing antimicrobial treatment keeps this underwear feeling fresher longer
Breathable mesh improves airflow, enhancing comfort while traveling
Quick-drying fabric is ready to wear within hours so you can wash, go, and pack less
Active fit enhances comfort during high-impact activities
